intro: Rhynchopera cobanensis, commonly known as the Coban grass, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant features narrow, blade-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Rhynchopera cobanensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
